title: Zuiho Yamaguchi
text:
is a Japanese Buddhologist and Tibetologist. He is an emeritus professor at the <a href="University%20of%20Tokyo">University of Tokyo</a>, where he also took his doctorate degree in <a href="Sanskrit">Sanskrit</a> in 1954. He also studied in <a href="Paris">Paris</a> and for many years was a researcher at the <a href="T%C5%8Dy%C5%8D%20Bunko">Tōyō Bunko</a>. He retired in 1986.
Zuiho Yamaguchi specializes in the history of Tibet and studied include the manuscripts of Dunhuang, but also dealt with other subjects, such as the Tibetan calendar which he published a work in 1973 in Japanese. He also did a thorough investigation of facts surrounding emperor <a href="Langdarma">Langdarma</a>, where he challenged the assertion that Langdarma was a persecutor of <a href="Buddhism">Buddhism</a> and a supporter of <a href="Bon">Bon</a>.
